titleStmt.title: A song. As I walk'd by an Hos--pi---tal, I heard an old woman cry if Jove would be so kind me once more before I dye, as let me to enjoy the bliss which nature hath design'd: but alas! who will the cause redress, of an old woman poor and blind.

A song. As I walk'd by an Hos--pi---tal, I heard an old woman cry if Jove would be so kind me once more before I dye, as let me to enjoy the bliss which nature hath design'd: but alas! who will the cause redress, of an old woman poor and blind.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for G.S. and are to be sold at the Oxford-Arms in Warwick-lane,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "As I walk'd by an Hos--pi---tal,".
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
